body_html:
Please fill the template for issue reporting (it's the standard text when you submit a new issue, you just have to fill the gaps), without those information it's very hard to find the problem.

For example: You don't provide a reproducible example, nor any information about TF version, the optimizer you're using, or the functions you're calling to construct your network. And the problem can be related to either your loss, your optimizer, or your network construction.

Also, if you don't think it's a bug in TF's code nor a feature request, but rather a question, you should post it on StackOverflow — it is the standard place for asking for help and the community over there is bigger. ;-)

Also, if you don't think it's a bug in TF's code nor a feature request, but rather a question, you should post it on StackOverflow — it is the standard place for asking for help and the community over there is bigger. ;-)
body:
Please fill the template for issue reporting (it's the standard text when you submit a new issue, you just have to fill the gaps), without those information it's very hard to find the problem.

For example: You don't provide a reproducible example, nor any information about TF version, the optimizer you're using, or the functions you're calling to construct your network. And the problem can be related to either your loss, your optimizer, or your network construction.

Also, if you don't think it's a bug in TF's code nor a feature request, but rather a question, you should post it on [StackOverflow](http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/tensorflow) — it is the standard place for asking for help and the community over there is bigger. ;-)
